    • IsElfish

      public boolean IsElfish​(java.lang.String word, int count)
      Determining whether a word is elfish or not. A word is considered elfish if it contains the letters: e, l, and f in it, in any order.
      Parameters:
      word - string to be checked
      count - When one of the letters e, l and f is found, the counter increments one.
      Returns:
      true if the word is elfish

    • selectionSort

      public void selectionSort​(int[] array, int index)
      This method sorts the array of elements. (ascending order)
      Parameters:
      array - int array to be sorted
      index - index increments one for each item. (from 0 to the size of the string)

    • evaluatePostfix

      public int evaluatePostfix​(java.lang.String postfix, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> stack)
      This method evaluates the postfix expression. If the given string null or empty, this method returns zero.
      Parameters:
      postfix - string of the postfix expression
      stack - Stack is used for pushing operands.
      Returns:
      int value of the result of this operation.

    • evaluatePrefix

      public int evaluatePrefix​(java.lang.String prefix, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> stack)
      This method evaluates the prefix expression. If the given string null or empty, this method returns zero.
      Parameters:
      prefix - string of the prefix expression
      stack - Stack is used for pushing operands.
      Returns:
      int value of the result of this operation.

    • printMatrix

      public void printMatrix​(int[][] array, int i, int j, int counter, int lowerBound_i, int upperBound_i, int lowerBound_j, int upperBound_j)
      This method prints the elements of an mxn array. It travels on the elements of the array in a spiral form.
      Parameters:
      array - to be printed
      i - x coordinate
      j - y coordinate
      counter - the counter increments one for each time. (from 1 to m*n)
      lowerBound_i - is the lower bound of the x coordinate (0 value should be used for starting)
      upperBound_i - is the upper bound of the x coordinate (value of the m should be used for starting)
      lowerBound_j - is the lower bound of the y coordinate (0 value should be used for starting)
      upperBound_j - is the upper bound of the y coordinate (value of the n should be used for starting)

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This main method of this application.
      Parameters:
      args - array of string arguments.
